Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
ELIXIR coordinates and develops life science resources across Europe so that researchers can more easily find, analyse and share data, exchange expertise, and implement best practices. This makes it possible for them to gain greater insights into how living organisms work.

ELIXIR has compiled a list of resources that it recommends for the deposition of experimental data. The scientific community has a shared responsibility to ensure long-term data preservation and accessibility. The purpose of this Deposition Databases list is to provide guidance to those who formulate policy and working practices about the appropriate repositories for publishing open data in the life sciences.

An ELIXIR Deposition Database is defined as being part of the ELIXIR Node portfolio of services that accepts deposition of experimental data from an international community of researchers beyond the funding envelope of the database itself.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
https://elixir-europe.org/platforms/data/elixir-deposition-databases

There are many datasets here, including ArrayExpress, BioModels, EMDB, EMPIAR, MetaboLights, and the total amount of data stored should exceed 4PiB
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: We generate and send cars and related orders based on this document: https://github.com/tech-greedy/singularity/blob/main/getting-started.md.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, North America
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: Cloud storage (i.e. S3), HTTP or FTP server
